prior_works.title: SSCNet: 3D Semantic Scene Completion from a Single Depth Image
prior_works.authors: Shuran Song, Fisher Yu, Andy Zeng, Angel X. Chang, Manolis Savva, Thomas Funkhouser
prior_works.role: Foundational task/metric introducing semantic occupancy grids and evaluation for scene completion
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Established semantic occupancy voxel grids and IoU/mIoU evaluation, the conceptual and metric basis that Place3D builds on to define M-SOG as a task-agnostic surrogate for LiDAR placement quality.

prior_works.title: SemanticKITTI: A Dataset for Semantic Scene Understanding of LiDAR Sequences
prior_works.role: LiDAR dataset and benchmark operationalizing semantic scene completion with occupancy grids
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Demonstrated how to construct and evaluate semantic occupancy from accumulated LiDAR, directly informing Place3D’s use of semantic occupancy grids for placement scoring and downstream validation.

prior_works.title: Occ3D: A Large-Scale 3D Occupancy Prediction Benchmark for Autonomous Driving
prior_works.role: Modern benchmark standardizing 3D occupancy/semantic occupancy metrics and showing correlation with downstream perception
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Validated that occupancy quality is a strong proxy for perception performance, motivating Place3D’s choice of an occupancy-based surrogate (M-SOG) to predict multi-LiDAR placement utility.

prior_works.title: LiDARsim: Realistic LiDAR Simulation by Leveraging the Real World
prior_works.role: Realistic LiDAR simulation framework enabling arbitrary sensor pose evaluation
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Provided a practical way to render LiDAR returns for arbitrary sensor poses, enabling Place3D’s placement search and data generation without repeatedly reconfiguring real hardware.

prior_works.title: CARLA: An Open Urban Driving Simulator
prior_works.authors: Alexey Dosovitskiy, German Ros, Felipe Codevilla, Antonio Lopez, Vladlen Koltun
prior_works.role: Open simulator with controllable weather and flexible sensor rigs
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Established a standard engine for multi-sensor simulation and adverse-condition testing; Place3D’s multi-condition data generation and evaluation align with this paradigm.

prior_works.title: A2D2: Audi Autonomous Driving Dataset
prior_works.role: Real-world multi-LiDAR dataset demonstrating heterogeneous sensor layouts
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Showcased heterogeneous multi-LiDAR rigs on production vehicles, motivating Place3D’s focus on optimizing multi-LiDAR placement rather than assuming a single roof LiDAR.

prior_works.title: The Ford Multi-AV Seasonal Dataset
prior_works.role: Multi-vehicle, multi-sensor dataset across seasons (including multiple LiDARs)
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Highlighted the value of diverse LiDAR configurations and challenging conditions, directly motivating Place3D’s emphasis on robust placement under multi-condition scenarios.

synthesis_narrative:
Place3D’s core innovation—using a semantic occupancy–based surrogate metric (M‑SOG) to optimize multi‑LiDAR placement and validate it through data generation and downstream tasks—stands on three converging lines of prior work. First, SSCNet and SemanticKITTI established semantic occupancy grids as a principled 3D representation and provided well-accepted evaluation protocols (occupancy/semantic IoU). This made occupancy a task-agnostic yet perception-relevant target, enabling Place3D to define M‑SOG as a quantitative proxy for sensor layout quality independent of any specific detector or segmenter. The Occ3D benchmark further modernized and standardized occupancy evaluation in autonomous driving, empirically reinforcing the link between occupancy quality and downstream performance; this underpinned Place3D’s choice to optimize placements via an occupancy-centric surrogate rather than directly over every downstream model.
Second, realistic LiDAR simulation became viable with LiDARsim and, at a broader level, CARLA, which provide controllable environments, weather, and arbitrary sensor poses. These tools showed that one can systematically explore sensor configurations and conditions in silico, a capability Place3D leverages to search placement space efficiently and to generate multi-condition data for evaluation.
Third, real-world multi‑LiDAR datasets like A2D2 and the Ford Multi‑AV Seasonal Dataset demonstrated heterogeneous LiDAR rigs and the necessity to remain robust across seasons and environments. These datasets motivated Place3D’s emphasis on optimizing multi‑LiDAR configurations and validating them under adverse conditions, closing the loop from principled surrogate metric to practical placement design.
